issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

fields.summary: Axis2c web-services should generate soapfaults on errors

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: vmware: apparently, faults (e.g., host not found in DescribeResources) are not formatted correctly

comments.body:
Originally posted on 2010-05-16 00:29:16 by dmitrii

Sat May 15 17:29:16 2010: Request 185 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Ticket created by dmitrii.zagorodnov
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: vmware: apparently, faults (e.g., host not found in
 DescribeResources) are not formatted correctly
       Owner: dmitrii.zagorodnov
  Requestors: dmitrii@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: http://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=185 >


if VMwareControl issues a fault:

16:56:31 ERROR ?    MwareBrokerResponseType| FAULT returned by VMwareBroker: method failed: host 192.168.7.207 not found

jbix is not happy:

No, not fixed yet.

Originally posted on 2010-06-04 17:35:37 by admin
http://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=185 This is a comment. It
is not sent to the Requestor(s): No, not fixed yet.

Originally posted on 2011-07-25 16:58:43 by dmitrii
I need to reconsider how faults are returned from VMware Broker, but this is
not release critical.

Originally posted on 2011-07-25 16:58:44 by admin
https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=185 This is a comment.
It is not sent to the Requestor(s): I need to reconsider how faults are
returned from VMware Broker, but this is not release critical.

Originally posted on 2012-03-12 18:19:07
Error prop. discussion required with Chris maybe Dan, Dmitrii.

  
On Mon Jul 25 09:58:43 2011, dmitrii.zagorodnov wrote:

> I need to reconsider how faults are returned from VMware Broker, but this is

> not release critical.

Originally posted on 2012-03-12 18:19:08

<URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=185 >

Error prop. discussion required with Chris maybe Dan, Dmitrii.

On Mon Jul 25 09:58:43 2011, dmitrii.zagorodnov wrote:
> I need to reconsider how faults are returned from VMware Broker, but this is
> not release critical.

Originally posted on 2012-03-12 18:19:08
Error prop. discussion required with Chris maybe Dan, Dmitrii. On Mon Jul 25
09:58:43 2011, dmitrii.zagorodnov wrote: > I need to reconsider how faults are
returned from VMware Broker, but this is > not release critical.
This ticket relates to VMware. See https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/iaas/compatibility for latest hypervisor compatibility by version.
